creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Mr and Mrs Glenn Vinson
description: six long lines of delicate calligraphy preceded by two shorter lines at R and LRC
inscription: (Tatsuya hime / Iro o somenasu / Ikushio ka / Orihae miyuru / Aki no momiji ba. // Tatsuyama / Nishiki to miyuru / Mimiji ba no / Itodo shigure ni / Iro wa masuran]  (The autumn leaves / On Mount Tatsuta / looking like brocade / intensify their colors / in the autumn shower / Perhaps because even the underleaves are colored / the autumn foliage on Mount Tatsuta / is increasingly brilliant / looking like brocade. (AS) or: The Princess of Mount Tatsuya / Dyes the colors / Time after time / Deepening their richness-- / The autumn foilage. // The autumn leaves / On Mount Tatsuya / Looking like brocade / Intensify their colors / In the autumn shower.) (Patricia Fister, see publ.))
markings: top left when rolled, blue pen: [Gyokuran Waka]
title: Two Autumn Poems
